data.text:
@brose847 @jfazli @PHLPublicHealth Yes- the dashboard uses positivity rate for PCR + antigen tests, while the COVID tier metrics use only PCR. 
My colleagues also analyzed the tier system here; the info at the bottom of the page explains the metrics: https://t.co/wa23rNg5o4

@PHLPublicHealth Alright. Here’s what you guys do. Once we are “all clear” just wait a week or so and then say you decided to align with CDC metrics for the future. Your Covid Tier system worked and we don’t have to keep flip flopping in and out of masks.
@PHLPublicHealth https://t.co/cXRAA7IjFj LA Is even ditching mask.

@eviltwingiraffe @PHLPublicHealth If they don’t scrap this system entirely, we most certainly will be riding the yo-yo back and forth. These are idiotic bureaucrats we’re dealing with, don’t be naïve.
@MenoDolce @PHLPublicHealth My first goal is to get them to acknowledge that we are currently in All Clear. Then we can work on not riding the yo-yo back and forth 🙂

@eviltwingiraffe @PHLPublicHealth Read the article. Applying these standards to the past two years, we'd have been unable to go without masks for a total of 5 weeks during that entire time. Yes it is hard to achieve and even harder to stay there.
@PHLPublicHealth What’s the penalty for not wearing a mask?

@PHLPublicHealth and yesterday it was slightly under 100 average.  So even if we somehow miraculously make this "all clear" stage, the numbers are going to ebb and flow. So at 99 we won't mask, but at 102 we will? (of course all dependent on under 50 hospitalized in a city of 1.5 million)
